OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format

OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(3) OpenAPI Descriptions: The Big Picture



OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(4) OpenAPI is Structured Data

  • APIs described by OpenAPI are described in a structured way
  • Resources [Resources: URI Paths (1)], interactions [Interactions: Operations and Parameters (1)], and representations [Representations: Requests and Responses (1)] are core concepts
  • OpenAPI must use a structure format to describe these concepts


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(5) JSON: Today's Standard Structured Data

  • JavaScript (1995) bridged many worlds because it ran in browsers
  • JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) (2001) became the web-scale data format
  • JSON is a good approximation for the data models of many programming languages
  • JSON is easy to understand but cumbersome to read and write
{
  "string": "example",
  "number": 42,
  "object": { 
    "key": "value"
   },
  "array": [ 1, "two", false ],
  "boolean": true,
  "null": null
}
  • minimal.json


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(6) YAML: JSON but more Readable

  • YAML Ain't Markup Language (YAML) started in 2001 as an alternative to XML
  • Around 2005 YAML started to align with JSON
  • YAML is human-centric and based on indentation as structure
string: example
number: 42
object:
  key: value
array:
  - 1
  - two
  - false
boolean: true
'null':
  • minimal.yaml


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(7) Minimal OpenAPI in JSON 

{ "openapi": "3.1.0",
  "info": {
    "title": "Greeting API",
    "version": "1.0.0",
    "description": "A simple API to return a greeting message."
  },
  "paths": {
    "/greet": {
      "get": {
        "summary": "Returns a greeting message",
        "responses": {
          "200": {
          "description": "A successful response",
          "content": {
            "application/json": {
              "schema": {
                "type": "object",
                "properties": {
                  "message": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "examples":
                      ["Hello, world!"] }}}}}}}}}}}
  • greet.json


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(8) Minimal OpenAPI in YAML 

openapi: 3.1.0
info:
  title: Greeting API
  version: 1.0.0
  description: A simple API to return a greeting message.

paths:
  /greet:
    get:
      summary: Returns a greeting message
      responses:
        '200':
          description: A successful response
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  message:
                    type: string
                    examples:
                      - Hello, world!
  • greet.yaml


OpenAPI as a Machine-Readable Format Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

OpenAPI Superstructure: Resources, Interactions, and Representations Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(11) Shaping Your API

  • Resources are the fundamental units of interaction
  • Interactions are how you access resources
  • Representations define how interactions exchange information


OpenAPI Superstructure: Resources, Interactions, and Representations Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(12) How the Web Works



OpenAPI Superstructure: Resources, Interactions, and Representations Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(13) OpenAPI is for Web APIs

  • Underlying technologies are the building blocks of the Web
  • Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) [https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986] is what you see in the address bar
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) [https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc9110] defines how browsers and servers interact
  • JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) [https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8259] is the data model of browser scripting languages


OpenAPI Superstructure: Resources, Interactions, and Representations Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(14) How APIs Works



OpenAPI Superstructure: Resources, Interactions, and Representations Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(15) URI Spaces 

/repos
  /{owner}
    /{repo}
      /issues
        /{issue_number}
      /pulls
        /{pull_number}
      /branches
        /{branch}
      /commits
        /{commit_sha}
/users
  /{username}
    /repos
    /followers
/orgs
  /{org}
    /repos
    /members
  • github-uri-space.txt

Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(17) Uniform Resource Identifier (URI)

  • Individual resources are identified by uniformly defined identifiers
  • Tasks are completed by traversing a number of resources
  • Scheme defines how identifiers are assigned: http
  • Authority defines a naming authority: openapi.org
  • Path is a hierarchical namespace: openapi.org


Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(18) OpenAPI: Organized by Resources



Resources: URI Paths Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(21) Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)

  • The language how browsers and servers communicate
  • Request/response model where the browser always initiates the interaction
  • Each request has a request method (e.g., GET)
  • Each response has a response status (e.g., 200 OK)
  • Requests and responses use header fields for metadata
  • Requests and responses can have a message body


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(22) HTTP Example: Accessing OAI 

GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: www.openapis.org
  • openapis-org-request.txt
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 262452
Cache-Control: public, max-age=604800
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Server: nginx
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31622400
Date: Fri, 19 Jul 2024 14:59:04 GMT

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en-US" class="no-js">
<head>
...
  • openapis-org-response.txt


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(23) Parameters in URIs and HTTP

  • A simple way to send data from browser to server
    • Embedded in URI: https://github.com/octocat
    • Appended to URI: https://github.com/octocat?tab=repositories
  • Limited in size (2kB is a relatively safe limit)
  • Data is part of URI and thus invisible to HTTP


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(24) URI Parameters in OpenAPI 

paths:
  "/users/{username}":
    get:
      summary: Get a user
      operationId: users/get-by-username
      parameters:
      - name: username
        description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
        in: path
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
  • github-get-by-username.yaml (line 1-12)
GET https://api.github.com/users/octocat


Interactions: Operations and Parameters Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(25) URI Parameters in OpenAPI 

paths:
  "/users":
    get:
      summary: List users
      operationId: users/list
      parameters:
      - name: since
        description: A user ID. Only return users with an ID greater than this ID.
        in: query
        required: false
        schema:
          type: integer
      - per-page:
        name: per_page
        description: The number of results per page (max 100).
        in: query
        schema:
          type: integer
          default: 30
  • github-users-list.yaml
GET https://api.github.com/users?since=1&per_page=20

Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(27) Data Exchange with HTTP APIs

  • URI parameters (embedded in the URI)
  • Media Types (rooted in Email and Browsers)
  • JSON (rooted in shared structured data)


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(28) Identifying Resource Types on the Internet

  • Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) started in 1992
  • Media Types became the new terminology in 1996
  • Identification for well-known content types (~2000)
    • Text: plain text, HTML, â¦
    • Images: JPEG, PNG, GIF, â¦
    • Application: PDF, XML, JSON, â¦
  • Many APIs have domain-specific data models


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(29) API Response with Media Type 

paths:
  "/users/{username}":
    get:
      summary: Get a user
      operationId: users/get-by-username
      parameters:
      - name: username
        description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
        in: path
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Response
          content:
            application/pdf: {}
  • github-get-by-username-pdf.yaml


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(30) Web-level Structured Data

  • JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) for exchanging structured data
  • application/json says nothing about the data itself
  • JSON Schema for describing valid structured data
  • OpenAPI uses JSON Schema for describing structured data


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(31) API Response: Structured Data 

{
  "login": "octocat",
  "id": 1,
  "node_id": "MDQ6VXNlcjE=",
  "avatar_url": "https://github.com/images/error/octocat_happy.gif",
  "gravatar_id": "",
  "url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat",
  "html_url": "https://github.com/octocat",
  "followers_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/followers",
  "following_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/following{/other_user}",
  "gists_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/gists{/gist_id}",
  "starred_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/starred{/owner}{/repo}",
  "subscriptions_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/subscriptions",
  "organizations_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/orgs",
  "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/octocat/repos",
  • octocat.json (line 1-15)


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(32) JSON Schema for JSON Data 

private-user:
  title: Private User
  type: object
  properties:
    login:
      type: string
      examples:
      - octocat
    id:
      type: integer
      format: int64
      examples:
      - 1
    node_id:
      type: string
      examples:
      - MDQ6VXNlcjE=
  • github-private-user.yaml (line 1-17)


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(33) API Response with Media Type 

paths:
  "/users/{username}":
    get:
      summary: Get a user
      operationId: users/get-by-username
      parameters:
      - name: username
        description: The handle for the GitHub user account.
        in: path
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Response
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                oneOf:
                - "$ref": "#/components/schemas/private-user"
                - "$ref": "#/components/schemas/public-user"
  • github-get-by-username.yaml


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(34) OpenAPI Components: Don't Repeat Yourself



Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(35) 30'000 ft View of OpenAPI 3.1.0

  • openapi: Defines which spec version is used
  • info: Provides metadata about the API
  • servers: Information about available servers
  • paths: Paths and operations for the API
  • webhooks: Support for server-initiated interactions
  • components: Reusable components for the description
  • security: Declaration of security mechanisms
  • tags: Used for grouping concepts across the API
  • externalDocs: Additional external documentation


Representations: Requests and Responses Erik Wilde: An Overview of OpenAPI

(36) OpenAPI: The Easy Bits 

openapi: 3.1.0
info:
  version: 1.1.4
  title: GitHub v3 REST API
  description: GitHub's v3 REST API.
  license:
    name: MIT
    url: https://spdx.org/licenses/MIT
  termsOfService: https://docs.github.com/articles/github-terms-of-service
  contact:
    name: Support
    url: https://support.github.com/contact?tags=dotcom-rest-api
servers:
- url: https://api.github.com
externalDocs:
  description: GitHub v3 REST API
  url: https://docs.github.com/rest/
  • github-preamble.yaml
